Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Foundation, students identify similarities and differences between themselves and others.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They name parts of the body and outline how their body is growing and changing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They demonstrate personal and social skills to interact respectfully with others.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students identify different emotions people experience.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They identify protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies to help keep themselves safe.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students identify different types of health information and how it can be used in their lives.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students apply fundamental movement skills to manipulate objects and space in a range of movement situations.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They recognise the benefits of being physically active.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students use personal and social skills to engage in fair and inclusive play.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Level 2, students explain how personal qualities contribute to one aspect of identity.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They describe physical and social changes that occur as they grow older.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They demonstrate personal and social skills and describe strategies to develop respectful relationships.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students describe how emotional responses affect their own and others’ feelings.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies that can help keep themselves and others safe.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students explain why health information is important for making choices.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students apply fundamental movement skills in different movement situations and explain how they move their body with objects and in space effectively.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They describe factors that make physical activity safe and beneficial.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students develop and apply rules while cooperating with others in a range of movement contexts.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Level 4, students describe influences that strengthen resilience and identity.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They describe strategies to respond to physical, social and emotional changes and transitions they experience.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They apply personal and social skills and strategies to interact respectfully with others.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students describe the influences that inclusion and the challenging of stereotypes have on choices and actions.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They explain the variation in emotional responses and describe strategies to manage emotions.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They describe and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies that can help keep themselves and others safe in online and offline situations.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students interpret health information to apply strategies that can enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students refine and apply fundamental movement skills and demonstrate movement concepts across a range of situations.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They apply movement strategies to enhance movement outcomes.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They perform movement sequences using fundamental movement skills.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students describe the benefits of regular physical activity on health, wellbeing and physical fitness.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They examine contextual factors that influence safe participation in physical activity and propose strategies to incorporate regular physical activity into their own and others’ lives.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students demonstrate fair play and inclusion through a range of roles in movement contexts.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Level 6, students explain how different contextual factors influence identities.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They propose strategies to manage developmental changes and transitions.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They explain how stereotypes influence roles and responsibilities.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students propose and apply strategies to demonstrate respect, empathy and inclusion to positively influence relationships.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They propose strategies to manage emotions and analyse the influence of these strategies on relationships.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They explain how communication skills, protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies can help keep themselves and others safe online and offline.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students analyse health information to refine strategies that can enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students refine and modify movement skills and apply movement concepts across a range of situations.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They transfer movement strategies between situations and analyse the impact on movement outcomes.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They apply the elements of movement when creating movement sequences.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students analyse the body’s response to physical activity of varying intensity.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They propose strategies to promote safe physical activity participation that enhance health and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students describe contributions they can make as a group and team member to support fair play and inclusion across a range of movement contexts.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Level 8, students analyse factors that influence identities and responses to change, and describe strategies to support themselves and others in responding to these influences.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They analyse how stereotypes, respect, empathy and valuing diversity influence relationships.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They analyse factors that influence emotional responses and justify strategies to manage emotions.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students analyse the effectiveness of assertive communication strategies, protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies applied online and offline (interacting with others).

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They analyse health information and messages to propose and design strategies that can enhance their own and others’ health, safety, relationships and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students apply and transfer movement skills and movement concepts across a range of situations.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They implement and evaluate the effectiveness of movement strategies on movement outcomes.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They adapt and apply the elements of movement to compose and perform movement sequences.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students propose strategies designed to achieve personal fitness and evaluate their impact on health and wellbeing outcomes.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They propose and evaluate strategies designed to promote personal health and wellbeing outcomes.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students apply and refine strategies to support inclusion, fair play and collaboration across a range of movement contexts.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: By the end of Level 10, students propose and evaluate personal strategies to manage their identities and responses to change and transitions.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They evaluate how attitudes and beliefs about equality, respect, diversity and inclusion influence the nature and quality of relationships.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They evaluate personal strategies to manage emotional responses to different situations and reflect on the impact of their ability to manage these responses on health and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students propose and evaluate strategies to manage online and offline situations where their own or others’ health, safety, relationships or wellbeing may be negatively impacted.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They synthesise health information from credible sources to propose and justify strategies that can enhance their own, others’ and the community’s health, safety, relationships and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students evaluate and refine their own and others’ movement skills and performances, and apply movement concepts in challenging or unfamiliar situations.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They adapt and transfer movement skills and strategies to unfamiliar situations and evaluate the effectiveness to achieve successful outcomes.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They apply criteria to evaluate and refine their own and others’ movement performances.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students critique the effectiveness of strategies designed to enhance health, fitness and wellbeing.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: They propose and evaluate community-based physical activity interventions designed to improve the health and wellbeing of themselves and others.

Subject: Health and Physical Education
Text: Students apply and evaluate leadership approaches, collaboration strategies and ethical behaviours across a range of movement contexts.
